      • findWindow

        public static WindowsJNA findWindow(java.lang.String className,
                                    java.lang.String title)
        Find the FIRST top level window with specified class and title.
        Parameters:
        className - such as "SWT_Window0" or null
        title - such as "QREADS" or null
        Returns:
        first window found, or null if not found.

      • next

        public WindowsJNA next()
        Get the next top-level window in Z-order, (from foreground to background). s To iterate all windows, use for (Window w = getForegroundWindow(); !w.isNull(); w = w.next()) ...
        Returns:
        new WindowsJNA object

        public static int createProcess(java.lang.String program,

      • shellExecute

        public static boolean shellExecute(java.lang.String filename,
                                   java.lang.String args,
                                   java.lang.String currentDirectory)
        Note: use runCommand instead of this, if possible. Use this to open a program or any kind of file, like pdf, jpeg, html, etc.
        Parameters:
        filename - - filename of file to open
        args - - arguments to pass to the shell command
        currentDirectory - - directory in which the file is located
        Returns:
        true on success.
